text:
Hi everyone i need this type of blog publish date formate please send me code
<https://prnt.sc/vduydx>

Hello
I’ve been given a landing page design where a single form is used in two locations; in the body hero and in the last section of the body before the footer

Currently, I’m embedding the form twice, which isn’t ideal.
This is primarily because the form has an inline response message rather than redirecting to a thank-you page.

I’m wondering if i can use javascript to move the form markup between two sections based on the page scroll depth

Has anyone dealt with anything like this before?

Thanks
<@UJW404KBQ> Yes you can move any html element as you want with javascript during navigation but it’s not a problem to have 2 form on the same page. Moving it will not be really beautifull and easy

<@U01DF3PNCKA> Thanks - I figured as much moving it could be a bit janky.

I’m going revamp the landing page template so it has a sticky form.
I just need to figure out how to get a css class added to the forms parent `.row-fluid-wrapper`
You want to add a class with javascript to an element ?
Any ideas why one JS file would be minifying and not another. Same portal. No errors on either.
